Table of Contents

Interface IBindableList<T>

Namespace
osu.Framework.Bindables
Assembly
osu.Framework.dll

A readonly interface which can be bound to other IBindableList<T>s in order to watch for state and content changes.

public interface IBindableList<T> : IReadOnlyList<T>, IReadOnlyCollection<T>, IEnumerable<T>, IEnumerable, ICanBeDisabled, IHasDefaultValue, IUnbindable, IHasDescription, INotifyCollectionChanged

Type Parameters

T

The type of value encapsulated by this IBindableList<T>.

Properties

BindTarget

An alias of BindTo(IBindableList<T>) provided for use in object initializer scenarios. Passes the provided value as the foreign (more permanent) bindable.

IBindableList<T> BindTarget { set; }

Property Value

IBindableList<T>

Methods

BindCollectionChanged(NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler, bool)

Bind an action to CollectionChanged with the option of running the bound action once immediately with an Add event for the entire contents of this BindableList<T>.

void BindCollectionChanged(NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler onChange, bool runOnceImmediately = false)

Parameters

onChange NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler

The action to perform when this BindableList<T> changes.

runOnceImmediately bool

Whether the action provided in onChange should be run once immediately.

BindTo(IBindableList<T>)

Binds self to another bindable such that we receive any values and value limitations of the bindable we bind width.

void BindTo(IBindableList<T> them)

Parameters

them IBindableList<T>

The foreign bindable. This should always be the most permanent end of the bind (ie. a ConfigManager)

GetBoundCopy()

Retrieve a new bindable instance weakly bound to the configuration backing. If you are further binding to events of a bindable retrieved using this method, ensure to hold a local reference.

IBindableList<T> GetBoundCopy()

Returns

IBindableList<T>

A weakly bound copy of the specified bindable.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown when attempting to instantiate a copy bindable that's not matching the original's type.
